item.title: Yulin Li (黎玉林) and Tong Zhou (周彤) joined our group
item.description:
Our group doubles again! Meet Yulin Li (黎玉林) and Tong Zhou (周彤)!

Yulin is our first PhD student. He’s interested in the self-organization of cellular systems, particularly, growing bacterial colonies. Tong, as our second Master student, will be working on the self-assembly of active particles. May the force be with them!

item.title: News article on our Science paper
item.description: A news article (in Chinese) on our recently published Science paper just appeared on a tech-review social media, DeepTech. The article introduces our works on active liquid interfaces to broad audiences, highlighting the potential applications of our results in industry and material science.

item.title: Our paper on active nematic defects appeared on PRE
item.description: Our paper titled “Active nematic defects in compressible and incompressible flows” appeared on Phys. Rev. E. Check it out on Phys. Rev. E or on arXiv.

item.title: Zihan Guo (郭子晗) joined our group
item.description: Meet Zihan Guo (郭子晗), the FIRST student in our group! Zihan recently received his Bachelor degree in Physics from Jiangxi Normal University. He has done some very nice simulations on three-body motion during his undergrade. In the coming years, he will try to develop a code to simulate colloidal particles immersed in active fluids. Welcome, Zihan!
